how do i find a mountpoint for an ISO?: , you can mount it where ever you want it and have the appropriate privileges to do so
open up Brasero, Select "Burn Image", under path choose the iso file. Allow it to finish. Shutdown you computer. Turn on your computer with disk in the drive. Windows Installation should begin.

just remember, if you install windows (XP, and I think Vista as well). It will overwrite the MBR (master boot record) on the disk it is installed on and you will not have the option of booting back into Ubuntu until you reconfigure your MBR.
